intro: Polyphragmon sericeum, commonly known as the silvery fringed orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the alpine regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and striking, pale violet to white flowers with fringed petals. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
